name: Seduce Me the Otome
description: A romantic comedy visual novel centered around a girl named Mika Anderson, who gets entangled in the affairs of incubi.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: - Graphics: - Sound Card: - Additional Notes: -

reviews.review_text: Tfw you live in a house with five incubi and still can't get laid. Most relatable protagonist 2015.
'Seduce Me!' ~The Spy from TF2
downloaded for jokes got attached to characters ♥♥♥♥ my life WHY SO LITTLE FANBASE

this game, oh BOY this game... let me tell you  if you are, like myself, a pansexual weeaboo who thirsts for good dating sims and hot anime sex, this might just be the game for you. disclaimer on my previous statement, there is no actual hardcore nudity in this game so I have no idea why it's tagged that way, and if you are looking for porn then look somewhere else. HOWEVER, this game does get sexual, so don't worry to the fanboys or fangirls or fanpeople who would be dissapointed to not get any of the action. I DIGRESS, anyway so...  STORY  I don't want to spoil anything, but the game description mentions that they are incubi, so like is that really a spoiler? anyway you end up living with five demon boys after a series of unfortunate events, and you can either fall in love with one of them OR, wait for it, DATE ONE OF THE THREE FEMALE ROMANCE OPTIONS?? so remember that when playing it, because even if you aren't aiming for the lesbian love, it could end up that way. on my first run my initial goal was Sam, but somehow I ended up with Diana. I was not disappointed though, becuase I love all the characters in this game.   CHARACTERS  while the boys do sort of appeal to certain tropes, you know, 'smart glasses guy' and 'secret tsundere tough guy' they still have their own personalities, back stories, and problems outside of the trope box. The girls are the same way. I wouldn't say this story taught me any new values or life lessons, or anything 'deep' like that. The characters are 100% likeable and enjoyable and if you are like me, projecting feelings-able.  SEXY STUFF  lot's of talking about the lead up to the moments right before the sex, and then it's like 'and then we had sex'. the sensual descriptions and touchy feely stuff is still hot, but like I said before this game isn't porn. BUT DON'T WORRY BECAUSE HOT DAMN THE SECOND GAME, I'm not going to lie, Sam's route made me have to turn on the air conditioner.  CONCLUSION  great game, personally I think it's worth your time. if you are a weeaboo fangirl, fanboy, fanperson, please play this game. I don't think you'll regret it, probably. unless your Malix, he probably regrets it.

10/10 fedoras  me and my friend played this game for 6 hours on another account, and 2 hours on this one.  and we must say. this game is. without a doubt. QUALITY. With a rich cast of characters such as sandwich b*tch, eyebrow bridge, a**hole f**kboi, tryhard flirt, and boring man (AKA a**hole's shadow), this game truly shows beauty in every form.  There are even side characters to choose from, including 'stereotypical lesbian', fluttershy, i-only-showed-up-like-once, and miss boobies!!  And if you don't like any of them? BECOME A DEMON F**KIN LORD!! BECAUSE WHY THE HELL NOT!!! Halfway through, the main character's face just disappears. It just kinda happened  So far we've screwed 2/6 men, and 2/3 girls. it's been wonderful to scream in fear as our ears get molested by 'uh~ uh~~ gahhh~sp~~' if after this ur not convinced to buy it (it's free so why not) then idk what to tell ya buddy   so yeah great game 10/10 would get molested again

11/10 Turned 5 Incubi into my butlers as I romanced 3 ladies thanks for cleaning my house boys.  In all seriousness: the writing in the beginning needed a little work, as well as some proofreading in some areas. That being said, the game gets entertaining later on and i really enjoyed the characters.  Its free you got nothing to lose: play it and laugh.

''He's in her house She doesn't know him He doesn't know her too He kisses her She slaps him  They fall in love.''  -----   *first time you play this game*  -What the f♥♥k?!! why the hell are this guys in my ♥♥♥♥ing house?!!  *next times*  -DUDE THEY ALWAYS LOOK HOT, IT'S NORMAL! :L  ---  Now, seriously, I love this game, and I'll always do. Great story. Great characters design. Great scenes, but in the demo the scenes and some of the characters were better... And finally, great choices.  You, creator (Michaela Laws) if you are reading this (not probably)  I love you. Not in that way. I love you for making this great visual novel-romance game.  I did not like visual-novels. And how I said, I did not like. But after I played this lovely novel♥ I needed more. More than this. I am waiting for the second part.  And after all, when you play this game, you enter in a world that you've never entered yet.  And by last. Let me make a little suggestion. Visual anime-novels. Based. In real anime romance series.  That would be awesome. Awesome. Like you Michaela.

Well, now that I've achieved all achievements I feel that I should contribute and review this game!  This is the first time I've played a game like this and it was actually a pretty good experience overall, especially since this game was Free-to-Play!   The first thing I noticed and liked about this game was how it has full voice acting! The voices seemed to portray the characters in the game pretty well and provided the player with an immersive experience. But even though overall the voices were a pro for me, there were times when I felt the voices got excessive and annoying but I learned that it can be countered by just disabling the feature or just clicking through the dialogue. Another thing I loved about the game was how each 'romance target' had a different story to tell. There were some overlays in history between the Demon Brothers but overall they each had different reasons for doing the things they did. Also great background music! I found the music pretty catchy in this game (especially the ringtone).  Some things I did not like as much was some of the art, how some parts of the story didn't go into enough detail, and the repetitiveness. Well the characters seemed slightly disproportionate and there were some people in the game that I thought looked like a mutant (the teacher) but I didn't expect too much out of a Free-to-Play game. The creator of the game provided a lot of cut scene art though so even though it wasn't amazing, it still provided players with a source of visual aid for the verbal descriptions and dialogue. So even though not great, still better than nothing at all. Also I felt like the story had the potential to become something better but because of the objective of the game (seduce everybody), everything was just glossed over and never really dug into. I mean at times I just felt information was shot at me and that I never really had the chance to digest it. If the creators went more in depth and explained some of the story, I felt the game would have been even better (I learned there was a sequel so its possible that they'll go more indepth on the story then). Last thing I thought was a con was the repetitiveness of the game. It is kind of to be expected since most of the individual characters' plots touch upon others but I still can't help but find it tedious to read the same thing over and over and over (I'm talking about the parts that aren't skippable but are still the same for almost all the characters (like the pre-ending dialogue.)  Overall Pros: FREE! Voice acting included Background music Interesting story  Cons: Some of the art Not going indepth on story Repetitiveness  Yup~ I would definitely recommend this game to people who are fans of female dating sims, especially since its free. Though there were cons, I felt that they weren't major enough to detract from the game. I was still able to enjoy it when I played through all the routes. Oh yeah! This game has male and female romance targets and not just all-male or all-female so people with different preferences can still enjoy the game.
This game has good voice acting, some fine boys, and a pretty good storyline. You can keep playing for hours with all the different choices you can make and it's free so, why not?

Cons:  - Awkward art style - Simplistic writing sometimes - Recycled dialogue - A couple of times the wrong name tag was used - Some of the romances were boring/dull/too short - The concept of 'love' is thrown around very loosely (which is something lots of romance visual novels/sims are guilty of, unfortunately) - Not a single character is a person of color (100% white people) and no, red-skinned devils don't count  Pros:  - Brings up the subject of consent (consensual sex) - Subtly brings up the subject of r/a/p/e (Steam censors that?!) - Brings up the subject of classism - Same-sex romances available - The overall story concept is quite interesting - A fair amount of humor - Some of the romances were interesting/entertaining (My favorites were: Damien and Diana) - As far as I know, there weren't any typos or scripting issues  Note: I played this game without sound, so I have no idea what the music or voice acting is like.  Despite the cons of the game, it was still entertaining enough to recommend it to those who like romance visual novels. Especially since it's free to play.

If you have issues falling in love with fictional characters. DONT BUY THIS GAME. You will fall in love with each characters story. I believe I heard something about a second coming out? This girl is super excited. Story is well written.

Just so people know this isn't my first otome game. Compared to others I played this scored a C+. The art of the characthers as you intereact with them is beautiful but when you get the gallery art pieces they are completely different level. It threw me off to be honest because I was expecting more. The voice acting wasn't amazing but it was still nice since it was different.  The thing that really threw me off was how the game was very short. Extremely short. Most of the time your time limit is a month to almost a year; whereas, this felt like a few days if not a week. The incubi were extremely boring. Of course there was times when you're like nice thats hot but other times where its overused dialog; and with five of them it gets boring real fast. Your thoughts as you progress courting the incubi is almost always 95% of the time the same. Then when they intereact you at certain points it is also the same with maybe one brother having more like 75% same dialog lines.  The women in my opinion were a better path to take but two of them are still slightly similar. I can see how they still say some things similarly but again your characther's thoughts are again practically the same. Lastly the last male option that is not an incubi was decent but not great.  I got this game for free so I was like why the heck not right? Unfortnately I learned that this game was a kickstarter game. This means that people funded this project to make the game. Usually when I hear kickstarter I expect so much more than what I had gotten.  This game was tedious and a bore to finish but I did just to make sure for this review. I was hoping something would happen to change my mind but no it didn't. Thanks for reading.  SPOILER ALERTSPOILER ALERTSPOILER ALERTSPOILER ALERTSPOILER ALERTSPOILER ALERTSPOILER ALERTSPOILER ALERTSPOILER ALERTSPOILER ALERTSPOILER ALERTSPOILER ALERTSPOILER ALERTSPOILER ALERTSPOILER SPOILER ALERT What I think was really awful was how the incubi were practically infatuated with you so quickly with most of them ending up declaring your love for you. How stupid is that. First of all one of them practically states that as demons they don't understand that emotion as they feed on sexual desire. It just wierd to me. Like honestly a sex demon fell in love with you in practically less than a week. Its like of course he likes you you're the only women hes been talking to stuck in that mansion. Pah. Also there was hint that they have been in the human world way before you met them for at least a while so its like obviously they can't just haven't talked to other women. Plus at least two of them could not have been virgins but obviously your charcther is oblvious to that or is just wishful thinking on her part no matter what information you had been given by them. Her ending thoughts bout how she finishes the game as in to what happens after high school is pathetic. Its almost always the same as in he or she supports me in whatever and that she doesn't know what to do.

It's at some points amusingly random. Like you could get killed... in a dating sim... That never happend to me before. On the other hand you could fall in love with almost every person, you have a longer conversation with (except teachers and your parents). And don't forget the Skip function, to just go to the points of decision. That's veeery important.
decent....no real nudity...bit of cleavage...meh...good game, might recommend, glad its free, and lots and lots of gameplay/storyline.

Really enjoyed the game and to make it better, it is free. I think the voice work is really good for a free game. So far my personal favorite male demon is Matthew.  The only negatives I could give is some of the paths use simular dialog and can't be skipped, and there is no option to check out the endings you have collected or have a list on how many endings are there.  Other than that, I highly recommend anyone to play this game and there is little to no risk to since it is free!

Where do I even begin to explain how bad this game is?  First, the positives. Your character can date other women. I didn't notice any glaring grammatical errors. It has non-romantic endings that aren't bad ends. The sex scenes are optional.  That's really about it.   Seduce Me  is a game about Mika Anderson, a girl who inherits a house that happens to be filled with sex demons, who greet her by  using mind control to make her okay with them kissing her and stealing her energy.  This is assault. She's a little freaked out by this, but for the most part takes it in stride. I did not take it in stride. I was appalled.  Early in the game, Mika tells Erik, one of the incubi to stop flirting with her, and his response is 'I like beautiful women.' That's harassment (she had JUST said to stop, yet he continued), but it's treated as romantic. Further on in his route, you learn he's such a flirt because   he's petrified of rejection  . This doesn't excuse his behavior at all. She said no.  The incubi (and one human boy) keep touching Mika without consent. This is seen as acceptable, presumably because it's 'gentlemanly' or some other BS. She did not say they could touch her. She does not reciprocate their touch. She is never given an option to say no.  In fact, despite an ACHIEVEMENT called 'it's okay to say no,'  Seduce Me  fails to address healthy consent on even a basic level. To get the 'true end' for the incubi, Mika must always 'keep going,' EXCEPT for where the sex scene is concerned. That's completely missing the point of consent, and undermining 'it's okay to say no.'  Some ways in which this fails are common to all demon routes. For example, Mika is told something is only going to work if she trusts a certain character. Instead of asking the player if Mika trusts him, the incubus whose route you're playing just TELLS Mika to trust him, and so Mika does.  Also, any demon you romance   kills someone in the course of the story. If you romance Diana, it's your  grandfather   . Mika isn't given the option to say she's not okay with that.  The consent issues are most clear in   Diana   and   Damien  's routes. The former talks about consent in sexual relationships as if it's a nice bonus and not a mandatory requirement. And Mika is just okay with that for some reason.   Diana   also mind controls humans, besides and including Mika, just because she can.  The latter is given a chance to earn his heart's desire by   sleeping with Diana  , which Mika opposes.   Damien  's views on this are unclear. Instead of talking this over like adults,   Mika gives Diana the go-ahead to assault him and wipe his memories  . It turns out the whole conflict was engineered anyway, but   Damien is still grateful that she made this decision on his behalf  , for some reason. This is partner abuse.  Besides the multitude of ways in which  Seduce Me  fails to handle consent maturely, there are other problems.  All the GxG routes have issues.   Diana's route, as mentioned above, is full of consent issues, but it's also not actually romantic. It ends with 'Maybe we'd find romance. Maybe not.' Suzu's route reinforces negative stereotypes of Italian-Americans. Naomi's route is generally okay, except for the problems it shares with Suzu's route and the problem all three of the GxG routes share.      Both of the human GxG routes only happen because of Diana's influence. The human GxB route also involves Diana's influence, but there Diana manipulates Mika's father so he'll stop pressuring her, and in the Naomi/Suzu routes the person being manipulated is Naomi/Suzu, respectively. So you only get with a human girl because she's being mind controlled. Additionally, the GxG routes are much harder than the GxB routes save Andrew. You have to go out of your way to end up with a woman, but you can end up with a man just by accident, which, as someone who prefers GxG, is aggravating.    Matthew's childishness is played up far more than it needs to be. I wouldn't have guessed he was an adult, and the text doesn't help you out there, either. People with young faces exist -- I know, I'm one of them. But having a young face, wearing hoodies, and liking cartoons doesn't make me a child, and the same goes for Matthew and his interests.  Overall, I thought this game was terrible, and I only played all the routes to see just how bad it is. Please, do something more productive with your time than playing this game.

I really enjoyed this VN. I've paid for VNs without full VAs, so the fact that this free VN of moderate length has that is amazing to me. My first playthrough took about 2 hours.  I wish you weren't limited to 24 save states though. I'm somebody who likes to 100% VNs so I guess I can always use the skip function, but more save states would be nice. Also, no clue why this is described as a comedy. Is every moment serious? No. But the overall tone of the story seems meant to be taken seriously.

Seduce Me the Otome is a free Visual Novel. Has multiple locations. Long story with multiple endings. Multiple Voice actors. You play a teen age girl. The story is modern, weird, supernatural and PG-16. Art style is western and good looking. Language is English. Multiple Animated characters.  It is Free, try it and delete it.

Also, I am trying to get all endings and a lot of the dialogue/writing is similar for the endings, etc. I was hoping for the 5 demons to have different personalities when it came to the smut part but most of it went all the same just a few word changes here and there for it.

'Asscakes. My name is Asscakes(Anderson).' 'That's a pretty name, I'm happy to know it now.' 'Nah it's not that nice' 'I have to disagree with you. It's much better than 'Andrew.' Who names their kid Andrew?' 11/10
The bloopers are hilarious, and I love this game.  10/10
Beautiful game. It has 22 endings. And things can get interesting. I just wish the game was longer.

ok...normally I don't review games, and I like to keep my opinions to myself, but this game had such incredibly positive reviews that I couldn't help but be disappointed. I don't get what people see in this game! I know that seems harsh but there is nothing new or unique with this game. There is too much going on, and it's too convoluted. Like, where is this game trying to go? The exposition takes way too long and in the end its like...okay and??? What did all that exposition have to do with anything??? Not to mention all the weird plot threads. I think the game dev should've cut her potential plot threads in half, it just makes the game seem really messy and unorganized. But the wort of all is I didn't feel any feelings whatsoever for any of the characters, which is not a good thing considering this is a DATING simulator. I mean, you don't have to romance any of the characters if you don't want to (which is neat!) but come on, these types of games are so character focused, that if none of the characters are likeable thats a BIG issue. Anyway, this game does have some good things going for it, and it's all around not too bad for a game that is free! I just don't understand all the hype, it's not as fantastic as it's made out to be.
To be totally honest i really enjoyed this game, The story line was outstanding kept me on my pc chair until the end. 10/10
I learned how a grill's heart works now thanks to the game, I will go try my newly attained skills on real grills.  I cried every teim 10/10 would Otome again

At first I didn't like the drawing style of this novel, but after some time I got used to it and I really enjoyed this game. Lots of different characters to choose from, also some steam achievements which is nice. Would recommend to anyone who likes to play VN.

This is a visual novel.  (Press *V* if you want a female robot voice to read it for you). You have multiple endings, voice acting for the other characters and music. Pick your name that can consist of up to 10 characters and the default is (Mika). The self named person you are controlling as is a female, there are same sex and different sex endings. Most of the ending points are the same, atleast close enough to almost be ignored. The boys all have the same body type with different stance, hair, eye color, cloths, personalitys (mostly) and backgrounds. This game has some plesant soundtracks, pictures, locations and voices. The scenes with the characters inner most feelings are kinda (Twilight)-like. Not a plus atleast for a guy like me. This game has 25 achievements ranging from end of storys, random and some in the mid of the story. The artstyle isen't the classic big eyed anime look and for me atleast it feels like a releave to have this as a break in that kind of looks from visual novels. The grammar in this game is actually really good. If you can handle the fluttering heart, playing as a character that feels like a fanfiction of something I do not recognize, then this game is one for you. 100 % is not that hard on this, but use a guide. My first end was (So Long, Sweetie. . .). If you want to then tell what your first blind one was.  Have fun, enjoy and keep that doll away from me :)
Really good game. Great soundtrack and fair warning, a lot of the routes will end with you getting major feels.

Ok I've only seen 4 endings. I got one bad one, one meh one, but the other two made me squee! I'm really enjoying this game. :)

I don't usually play this type of game (have only really played one other like it), but thought I'd give this a try and I'm very glad I did! Played it for ~4 hours right through and got two of the endings - and while I have to go back to see, I am very willing to believe the different endings and choices are /really/ different! It was a little slow at the start, I think, and some of the writing was a little clunky. But the voicing was very well done, and once I met Diana everything /definitely/ picked up. Gonna have to go through and play more endings, like I said, but delighted at the first proper ending I got! And the world building. And it's past midnight and I'm rambling now.

Would I recommend this game? I guess so.  The game does include an intriguing storyline, female and male romantic routes, and non-romantic routes. I also had a laugh with the blooper reel, which is pretty easy to unlock.   There are a few things I did not care for. For instance, there were some grammatical errors that were overlooked (ex. ending a sentence with a preposition). Also, the voice acting was not the always the greatest, and the character's personalities sometimes didn't match up with what they were saying. Occasionally, the artwork wasn't on par. I felt that Matthew's normal character didn't look the same as the detailed cg artwork. Furthermore, the stories were very similar to each other. Most of the time, exact sentences and sequences were copied from each other.  (As a side note, to get the full story with all the details, you need to play the other stories.)    Keep this in mind, this is my opinion which may differ from yours. I say to everyone take reviews with a grain of salt and experience it yourself.
I rate this game 6.5/10 - No other has had me enjoy getting sexually harassed by 5 sexy sex demons.
I got this game as a joke not expecting much. It's not the worst thing ever, but there are so many better vns you could be playing. It's a pretty cringey game and the art is mediocre.

The art is sub-par and the voice acting is amateurish. Storywise it might be great for those that like to be showered with false praise and live a fantasy world where they are worth anything. The music is the worst part I think. For the first minute it was fine. It started to be annoying after 10. After that I turned it off.   Settings are limited, but then again, one can not expect more than that really. This game is likely one of the first games produced by the people involved. For a first attempt it is ok, but not something that one should release. It should be polished and iterated upon. Wait for a later game as this one is not worth your time.

There are many problems with this visual novel. To save your time (and mine), it contains iffy artwork, stereotypical characters, bland voice acting, and dull romances. But worst of all, the cliché, poor attempt at writing “tear-jerking”, “heart-warming” scenes.   This otome is mostly targeted to weebs—obviously girl weebs. I mean, it has every element they desire: smexy, romantic men who will always accompany them, rich parents that “neglect” them, friends who consider them hot or cute, and the thrills of being in a “troublesome” environment. . . Sadly, they usually have none of this, and flock to visual novels such as this one to escape their “harsh” reality. Pray for them, everyone. Save them from this pile of stupidity and unrealistic ♥♥♥♥ they’ve gotten themselves into.   Anyways, I give this 2/10. I’m being nice since this was free. Sorry, but this just isn’t right for me.
Good storyline, nice voicing, can have lesbian endings with either classmates or a succubus. 10/10

I thought for a free game I would just play fr a few minutes and delete the game from my computer afterwards. But I was dead wrong. This is absolutely worth the download. It's free!!!  I can't believe a game of this quality is free. It is quite uncommon for otome games to have a voiceovers but even rare for nicely done voiceovers, but this one did it right. The story's good but short; nevertheless, gameplay will take for about a few hours trying to get all the endings (including female endings). The art is nice; it would be better if the characters have different poses as well instead of just having different facial expressions but that's just me.  Pretty interesting game and it actually woke up the otome gamer in me. I can't believe I actually have a soft spot for games like these.   10/10 :D

You play as a chick whos grandpa just died and you inharit his house. When you get to your new house, a bloody orgy pile of dudes wake up and make out with you. You date one of them, kill the guy who shot them and put them in the bloody orgy pile and send some other girl back to hell and live happily ever after. Honestly its a lot better/worse/whatever than I made it seem. There is a demon squirll named Simon. He rocks. Also the teachers face looks like it want to jump off her head and crawl back to hell from whence it came. And i would honestly be alright if that happened.

Surprisingly good.   I wasn’t expecting a lot from this title. It was a visual novel, and it was free. So, naturally my hopes weren’t too high. Still, I thought it would be an at least somewhat engaging time-waster. I’m happy to say that I was more than right – I actually ENJOYED this, which is more than I can say for about 90% of other visual novels I have played.   I won’t say its perfect, some of the writing is cringey, and at times the plot is predictable. There were some characters that felt flat, but maybe that was just me. Either way it really is an interesting concept delivered in a just-right-enough way that I can recommend it. That is, if you read the cons I just listed and still feel up for the venture.   I’ll close out this review by just saying my biggest gripe and my biggest praise about the game.  Gripe: Short. Now, albeit I’ve finished very few Visual Novels in my day (most just bore me,) so as far as I know this one could be super long compared to many others, but to me just when things were getting really good my chosen route ended. Yes, I know I can play other routes BUT I DON’T WANT TO CHEAT ON HUSBANDO CUS I’M NOT A HUSSY!  Praise: Voice acting is for the large part excellent. Most characters have very competent, dare I say even professional sounding VA behind them. Not all of them, but enough of them so that this would easily be one of the best things I’ll remember about this game.
I'd rather cut my ballsack off, wear it as a cap and then proceed to mercilessly scroll♥♥♥♥ a leopard than play this game again  10/10 would recommend

Look, you've got a story called 'Seduce me,' so why does it take forever to actaually get onto the stuff involving members of the opposite sex? I followed it for about 30 minutes (which was about 28 more than my intuition told me), and it was just dire.  This is dirt-cheap game production. I could probably program this, and I'm certainly no expert. But it's a way to pass the time. It could be a lot better. The story is not just utter crap, but the most amateurish writing I've seen in a very long time; elementary-school standard. The characters are absurdly stereotypical. The choices offered to you are few and far between, and seem to have no impact on the storyline at all. Is there any reason why the characters couldn't be personalised? Instead of asking simply what name you want your character to have, why not ask about skin colour? Hair colour? Hair style? Facial features? Straight or gay? Hell, why not ask if you want your character to be male or female, adjusting the story suitably? And given that it's hardly a gripping storyline, why not just cut to the chase and get onto the seduction bit?  Which isn't much of a seduction bit. Why not have a choice about whether your character is going to kiss him or not? And with the kiss, why not have a choice about whether to do it again? push him away? drag him off to a bedroom? do it right there in the foyer with his brothers watching?   This game could be a lot of fun, and seriously filthy! With more frequent choices that actually affected the story, it could have been a lot more entertaining. As it was, it's like a young girl's English homework, with a few pics and sound effects attached by her big brother, who's in a high-school omputer class.  But hell, if you're bored and don't fancy paying out for a new game, it kills time. I wouldn't say anything better than that.

i thought this would be some random heterostraight visual novel thing again like everything else and when i downloaded it i felt the same sin as when i played huniepop and nekopara but then i ignored the guys skipped through everything and got suzu my true love  10/10 would suzu again
If I use the power of my imagination to pretend that the husbando to be my waifu then I will be okay...  Think about the happy places...

Otome, huh? Never played one of those before, I thought as I noticed it pop up in the 'newest' section on the store's front page. The art looked nice though. And hey, it was free, so what was there to lose?  Only roughly five to six hours of time really. Once I started, I really couldn't pull away from the game anymore.   Pros:     Nice art that made me really excited about trying to unlock all of the gallery images (which was relatively easy to figure out)    Interesting characters. Honestly, at first I was worried that they'd be purely stereotypical. You have your charmer, your bad boy, your jester, etc. But the more you play, especially if you follow a specific character's path, the more you learn that they're in fact all a little more multi-dimensional.     The ability to romance male and female characters!  From what I've seen glancing over Otomes so far, it looks like most of them don't offer this option. There's 6 male and 3 female options and I found myself enjoying every one of them.    MC with options. To me it felt like the MC was kinda multi-dimensional as well, depending on your choices. And thank GOD she wasn't just a passive,  I'll just let everything happen to me  character.    Pretty good voice acting. Considering the fact that, as far as I know, they aren't professionals, they did their job really well. I definitely bought the emotions they were portraying.   Cons:     No voice acting for the MC. Some other users stated this too and I honestly agree, it kinda broke immersion to hear everybody speak aside from the MC (and the narration). This does offer the option for the player to better identify with the MC I guess? But to me, I would've preferred a voice actor for her as well.    Slight repetitiveness. With that I mean, in some cases, no matter your choice, the narration will be exactly the same except for a change of names. A little disappointing, but again, this is a free game, I have no idea how high the budget for it was, etc.    Lack of build-up. Don't get me wrong, I really loved the romantic paths, but some of them felt a bit... hard to believe? Oh yes, we've known each other for less than a week but I'm totally in love with you. Ehhh...    Following up the above point, I felt a little rushed sometimes. Kinda wish you could have the romance develop a bit slower and over more time.   Nonetheless, I feel like I might well replay this game sometime in the future -- or just look at the artwork a few more times. While there are some cons, I do feel that the positives outweigh them.  9/10 would play again.

Heartmelting. I felt like a true part of the story. A man like James is just a pinch of a dream. So gentle, kind and yet passionate . Cried as i died at the first attempt and at the bad ending... Worth playing..!
Look this really is one of the best games ever, ive spent more time in this game than I thought I could put in too a game, just play it you will understand.

10/10  All though i wish to see better quality of graphics the story was amzing, cant wait to see the creater come out with seduce 2 and hopefully with more options!  I m excited to see it come out, quite enjoyed it.  Daim was the best, quiet and shy and of course the least fav son. And something about him made me pick him. Sam was to... difficult and matthew just to young. XD each there own. Check it out a great free to play with a sequal coming!
Amazingly beautiful story game! I will definantly put at least 15-20 hours in. Can't wait for more!

I've played this game just for a few hours so far, but I relly enjoy it. Playing my role as a girl was a bit confusing and plot did not seem that interesting at first, but as the story progressed and got more interesting, I got used to it.  I really recommend you to try it out. Esspecially since it is free. I would be willing to pay around 3€ for it after I had a chance to try out a demo of the first 10% of the story or so.

'Well, it's free' is turning up in a lot of these reviews and yeah, that's one reason for sure. Grab it just for the voice acting bloopers and you won't have wasted the time you spent downloading it.  It's an interesting little story with each ending revealing another chunk that other endings don't reveal. The art is fine. The writing isn't quite polished, I'd say high school level or enthusiastic middle schooler writer level (been there, done that). There was just some awkwardness and poor word choice either for connotation or totally not meaning what the writer thought they meant but it's not cringeworthy. The intimate scenes are still fairly hot despite the amateur writing. The MC can have a varied personality based on your choices, which is refreshing.  The boys, as far as you get to know any except whichever one you go for (if you even go for one of them; you can get with the girls too), are the usual architypes: quiet one, smart/sophisticated one, cutely boyish one, shameless flirt, and finally, the 'bad boy' i.e. a s s h o l e. Unfortunately, the last one is done in a way I just hate. When girls say they like 'bad boys' they DON'T mean they want a guy who treats them like s h i t unless they're alone with him and he reveals his secret sensitive side. Other feminists have gone into better explanation of why this is not good so I won't repeat them.  I was annoyed that a huge section of story branches gets cut off if you make the seemingly arbitrary choice between going out with your friends or staying and fixing up the house with the boys (there's a part later where you can take food to one of the guys, and if you went out then you simply can't find any of them. I think this part should give you a second chance to connect with one, unless the creators wanted to punish you for going 'oh thanks for doing all the work while I go out with my pals, suckers'). I really wish there was an option to get to know each of the boys a bit before picking who to persue. It would fix the somewhat frenetic pacing too.  Save often and make use of the 'skip' function to fast-forward through the stuff you've seen already and you shouldn't waste too much time on the replays. Also, there's a guide to each ending so you don't have to fumble through if you don't want to.  Another peeve is that some of the responses are timed, others aren't, there isn't really much warning when they start GETTING timed, and the countdown bar is almost completely transparent. I would prefer no timed sections (especially the ones where there are something like ten choices to read through and choose one of before the time runs out) but at least make your countdown bar visible. I whiffed the first choice in one conversation not realizing it was counting down until the choices disappeared and the conversation moved on; only then did I see the barely-visible countdown bar.  The voice acting wasn't bad but I feel like it took me out of the story or made me too self-conscious at points so I just turned it off. Like I said before, though, the bloopers are worth the listen.  Overall not as good as something like Magical Diary but for a freebie it has plenty of merit, give it a shot.

My personal review.  Pros:  •You get to beat the ♥♥♥♥ out of a guy who takes your first kiss •James is the smartest   Cons:  •Mika doesn't realize five guys in the house could mean trouble •Isn't shocked five guys are bleeding in her house •Doesn't call the police like a normal person •Doesn't like economics class •Stuff happens way too fast, all events happen within a period of about two weeks.   5/10 I would recommend for eye candy. But not for story. I'm half and half on this. James made it mostly 5/10 he my hero

This was a really nice otome game. There are three female romance options and the rest are male options. It actually lets you have more control over your character's reactions and personality. Its not corny or predictable. Its actually quite sweet at times and it does a really good job of making a lot of empowering 'girls can be strong' moments where the female lead meets other strong female characters who are in positions of power. Its really a good game and well worth the time you spend playing it. The voice acting was spot on and very varried. I didn't feel like it was amateur voice acting work at all and I really enjoyed it. Well done!  You don't feel like you're being just dragged along with the story. Instead you get to make dialogue choices and main character deicisons on how they react to the situation. Its no 'Telltale Games' decision heavy but for what it is, an otome game, the decisions do feel like they have some weight and its good to have those choices.  I also enjoy that there's always an option to back out of a romance or situation. The frisky scenes are optional and don't alter the game which I think is nice. Overall the game was worth playing and all the CGs are pretty cute. Damien was my favorite character personality so far. I can't wait for the sequel.

Free Otomes are usually trashy and worth it's price;  This. This game right here.  Is outstanding.  Good Job.  Enjoyed: ( Only played one route so far) The voice acting..IN ENGLISH?! [Rare as shizz for otomes] Fully-voiced Cute Bloopers INDICATION ON WHETHER OR NOT YOU MESSED UPYOUR ANSWER WITH A HEART THUD (Ty creator. Tysm) GIVES YOU THE OPTION TO LOVE THE WOMEN AS WELL. ( I particularly like that they didn't restrict you to a gender)  Disliked: Their surprised faces made me choke. LMFAO.  Could have slightly better drawn pixies?  Overall I'm enjoying the game so far~ KEEP CREATING PLEASE Q~Q

I didn't expect to like this game, given the premise, but it was actually a fairly entertaining story and the voice acting was good. I think it would've been cool if there was at least one    succubus in the beginning with the incubi, rather than just the one you meet later. It could've changed the dynamic between them and your character in an interesting way.    If you can look past a bit of cringeworthy dialogue and the somewhat predictable story, it's fun. Especially for a free game.
Wow, enjoyable and gripping. I'd certainly pay for it.

I found this to be an amazing game. I love how each character has their own personality and backstory. I have recommended this game to many people. The one thing to make the game better is to add achievements. Other than that, 10 out of 10.

While I'm not the person to play games like these, something drew me to this game. I don't know what it was but this game just intrigued me. This is the first visual novel game that I've played and it is definitely a memorable one. After playing it I just got so into it. This game has multiple endings, after getting one ending I found myself constantly starting new games to see what endings I could get. The story itself is definitely interesting, not one I have seen before (then again I don't know this is my first visual novel) The characters themselves are definitely unqiue in their own ways and the abilitiy to make your own choices definitely adds to the depth of the characters. I would recommend this game to anyone just looking for a random game to play when they don't know what So; Pros: -Intriguing story -Good voice acting (for the most part) -Artwork is nice -Multiple endings -Interesting characters -Beautiful environments -Good humor bits -Nice soundtrack -Cute anime chicks -And for the girls, there's mainly cute anime boys. I'm not complaining but hey at least the creator gave us guys the girl options. -IMMA SAY THIS RIGHT NOW BUT THERE'S LESBIAN ENDINGS AND THAT'S ♥♥♥♥ING GREAT  Cons: -While the voice acting is good for the most part there are some iffy moments with delivery -Some of the artwork is subpar  -Speaking of voice acting, I would've liked for Mika (protagonist) to have voice actor, I'm somewhat confused that she didn't -Certain content is reused -This is a certain nitpick of mine but I would've liked an option to view the endings you have and tell you which ones you do not have -No sex scene with the hot demon chick :(  I'm still having a lot of fun with this game and I'm looking forward to more content from the creators. Also, I cannot begin to express how hype I am for the sequel.   BTW: There's 3 endings where the girl gets naked. Granted you can't see that much but it's still nice.
Fantastic. Had me squealing like a teenage girl throughout. Ending felt rushed...but HEY. Its FREE. Definitely recommend this otome.

Really worth your time. The developer has done a great job filling the setting with varied characters (all with voice actors), and a number of mysteries to uncover. A variety of endings catering to different tastes mean you'll want to try again and see who else you can end up with.  Plus it's free. All you have to lose is somet imes and hard drive space.

I really love this game, it's the first Otome I have ever played and I will be playing more in future solely because of how good this game was. I palyed all the story lines and got almost all (can't figure out one) of the acievements in two days. I couldn't stop playing. The only issues I have with it is there are parts that that seem to indicate that something will happen or could happen that don't go anywhere and the story lines with non-demon charcters are not very well developed.   Of the various romance paths I found that the sexiest one to follow was Erick, and the most fleshed out story line was Damien's. All of them are good though, but I have to admit I loved the Damien story line most.

Still at the beginning, only having gotten the first achievement, and I'm loving the game so far. (mild spoilers alert) When Dad was being a prick I, in real life, was all 'god damnit dad!' I burst into laughter and had to write this review however, when I learnt that the father's name was, in fact, the same as mine. As a person who just finished Senior Year High School as well, I feel that, while the teenage characters so far are a bit of a stereotype, they're still very believable. The voice acting is 99% very good, except when you press v for the self-voice. However, it's understandable, as the 'self' is meant to be voiced by yourself to add yourself into the character, and as such I never use it. Overall, I'm really enjoying the beginning, and can tell it's going to be a good game at the very least.

I wasn't expecting much from this game. I've played a few free otome games and they have somewhat decent story lines, but the main character is typically intolerable. I've never really felt like I could connect with the character. This one gives you more options for your choices and she has a less passive personality. My one complaint is that the art isn't great. It's not particularly bad, but it's a bit odd and slightly amateur. I still have not explored all that this game has to offer, but I look forward to seeing what else is in the game.

Nutshell: Better than I'd expect for a free otome game, but still a free otome game.  Cute game, fairly short and sweet but with a variety of character paths (including three F/F, which is always a plus for me) and several non-romantic endings (one of which was actually my favorite overall). The writing is competent and the character cliches feel knowingly-implemented rather than purely lazy.   The most disappointing aspect of it for me was the degree to which the scenes/dialogue are copy-paste for the different incubus routes. Anime cliche characters don't bother me, but reducing them all to nearly the exact same gushy, saccharine dialogue one you're on their romance path does. The boys nominally have different personalities; that should show up in their romances!  Also more than a little jarring to hear an incubus character ♥♥♥♥-shaming a succubus character. No, really.
+multi routes -short -why same plot for 5 characters?
Honestly I used to hate Visual Novels , But, Getting slapped by my dad showed me;   Moving into a house finding 5 strange boys, and I marry one of them.
I don't really understand the point of this but is ok, seems pretty interesting

10/10 Noami is bae,  Would Recommend if your true being is to be a 10/10 lesbian lover  PROs -  Hot Noami Gurl Decent BackGround music  CON's No actual sex :(  You only kiss once with Noami (Spoilers)   Overall -  if you want to hit me up on text dial 416-967-1111  for good time and good prices  (its pizza) I love this game  I love Noami Marry me plz
I love the boys (JAMES WHY CAN'T YOU BE REAL) and cute friendos (SUZUUU). But Diana. DIANA. DIANAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA 10/10
When is seduce me 2 comming out ?? BTW i loved the game my favorite ending was to go with Diana to demon world.
seduce me is one of those games that make you temporally fall in love with a fictional character and it's great. 10/10 by far my favorite free otome game, can't wait for seduce me 2.
Quite addicting for an otome visual novel. Great voice acting.Too bad... Simon wasn't a selectable route. Looking forward to the sequel for this story.    lol for the blooper.

The visual novel itself has me drawn from the first look, I never get around to reading many visual novels. However this one had me glued to my seat ... everything about the storyline had me bewildered with excitement. I simply adore all the characters... the female protaganist was just adorable. Wasn't too keen on Malik haha , But oh well .. in the end I felt sad since I had finished the novel under four hours. The ending song is also just beautiful , as well as the design of the novel itself.  I cannot wait for Seduce me 2!  Overall I rate the novel 10/10 for everything.

I loved everything about this game, actually! The characters are full-rounded and you notice that more and more you play in different endings. I also reccomend playing more and just tweaking your choices in your gameplay just to see what it will happen, I know people don't always have that stamina, but believe me -- it's worth it at times. It's quite intriguing, nonetheless. Surprising too! Y'never know what one choice can do in affect!  I guess the only real pros or cons, which is all in the same since everyone has a different type of tea: It is sort of cliche, the incubi. But, for me, I kind of like the cliche. I know some people might not particularly adore it, which is why it is worth mentioning.  I love the music soundtrack and I adore the voice acting. I laughed so hard at the bloopers of the voice actors, honestly!  I absolutely a hundred percent adore and would reccomend this game (addicted after twenty four hours) AND I am so happy to know that the second one is coming out very, very soon!
I use this game to prank my friends 10/10 would prank again

Pretty decent for my first visual novel on Steam! The plot is the sort that never leaves your MC in a good place for long. I enjoyed all of the characters and adored the voice acting! Very nice. My only complaint would be that some scenes were repeated no matter which romantic interest you pursued (at least for the men), for example, kissing scenes were near identical apart from scenery changes and names. I'd like it a bit more if they were more customized and original to each character. Another thing, after a certain point in the novel you can longer see your MC's portrait and reactions at the bottom left of the screen. I found that a bit odd.  Otherwise, definitely give it a try! Thank you to the creators and all involved for a chance to play through!

This was my first visual novel and I have to say it is pretty good. Yes, it's a little far-fetched, but if you can wrap your head around the concept of a book/novel being presented as a game with decisions that can change the outcome, you should be fine. Honestly, I was going through this in a very comedic mood, so I had a blast and cracked wise for a good two and a half hours. Granted, it is no Mass Effect or Walking Dead Season 1 ending that will syphon your tears from you or give you a great sense of jo and accomplishment, BUT it is a good game. I genuinely enjoyed it and recommend it to anybody looking to pass their time and not regret it.  8 out of 10

This game is SO GOOD! Honest;y, it's way better than I expected. The art is good, some scenes better than others. I've played through 3 routes so far, and plan on finishing the rest. I'm so glad that there is a skip feature once you get through the whole thing once, making it easier to choose your route without reading all the dialouge. And there is a LOT of that. The voice actors are good, and thier bloopers are hillarious. Definitly reccomend!
Great Game

Wow, this was way more than I expectd from any free otome that I ever saw. I don't know why this game is free or why it isn't everywhere. I easily sunk 15 hours into this game making sure I saw every expression and heard every word. (Watch me play it for another 10 just to see it all again....) I'm definately going to keep these folks in mind when looking for material in the future. There may not have been too much to it, but there was still plenty to go around and as much as would have loved for a little more steamy variety between the base choice of the guys and their individual circumstances, I still felt each one was a sucessful... I guess, love. I was surprised how much thought went into the backstory for the characters and the voice acting was phenominal. I can't wait to finish all the extra chapters and that dramaCD *wink wink*, Anyway, before I spoil too much, I really, REALLY enjoyed this game. Lots of love to everyone who had a hand in creating it!

For a free otome game, this is really nice. I didn't expect it to be as nice as it was. The story was really good and the characters all had different, but wonderful, personalities. I enjoyed reading them about them interacting with each other and my character. It was also not too easy to get any one character. I had to think about it and really work on focusing on one so that I could get their ending. I have even played the epilogue episode that was offered for free on the developers site.   My favorite of all of the characters would have to be Sam. The moment he was introduced I was like.....OH MY GOSH! GIMME GIMME GIMME! But I didn't get him at first cause I messed up a little by not paying enough attention to him to get him to want to stay with me, so I ended up with Diana with an early end. I was upset but I tried again and fixed my mistake. I was happy to get him when I did. He made me scream and roll around on my bed. Sam is just the best in my opinion. I really want to play with him some more.
10/10 would recomend to play

ok when i first got this game i wasnt expecting much, but as i got further into the game, it got really good and i mean really good. i was totally suprised. it was just amazing. i only got this game because i thought i would see some bewb or somthing, and i really hate having to delete it because other people get on my pc and the game is called 'seduce me' so yea. any way JUST GET IT

Decent game for a freebie, interesting plots, although all the make out scenes are about the same.  The voice acting gives me a horrible case of the giggles, though. Over acted and hilarious when intoxicated.
Seriously I would've paid for this game. Why can something so good be free?!

This game can become very addicting very easily. There are many endings, so I had to unlock them all! A total of 6 men endings, 3 female endings, and a few others depending your route. I love the game, and I'm very tempted to help out with the kickstart for the second one. I'm sad now though.... I've completed all routes and unlocked all the pictures. Also, there are some text repeats which is a little sad, but I'm sure it will be different in the new one when it comes out.

Just finished first playthrough and became a Demon Overlord...Overlady...Whatever.  10/10, who needs romance? :P  In all seriousness, it's very good for being free. The art is nice, the music is good, the writing is decent, and I enjoyed playing a main character who wasn't 'damsel in distress' all the time.  Unlocked none - that's right, NONE - of the romance options, but that just means I'm going to enjoy the next playthrough and make completely different choices.  The only critique I have is the voice acting, I feel grandpa's voice should've been a little deeper, and sometimes the other lines felt forced. But other than that, very nice game, will definitely replay!

I could tell this game was good the moment I started. The art style was a little weird, but I quickly got into the story. Multiple endings, generally a good dating sim yada yada yada. The bloopers. OH MY GOD THE BLOOPERS. They are the BEST things ever. I would pay just for them. DBZ and Tamaki references made me laugh so hard I got a cramp. This is my first review, and man you should play this

I am shamefully addicted. Not a revolutionary game by anyone's standards, but it's so. Damn. Fun. I wouldn't recommend to anyone who doesn't already like dating sims, but if you do you ought to give this one a shot. Oh, and you can be gay!!!!

i really do love this game and i am excited for the sequel ,there is nothing i dislike about this game , charecters or even the story the voice acting is amazing and i love how unique each charecter is and there past sometimes really pulls at some heart strings with me i honestly say for a free visual novel give it a try it you wont regret it and not only can you interact with guys you have some wonderful ladies there to you can win the hearts of. I do love how the story behind each charecter have something different to them that makes you see things different each time you play and you have to playthrough all the routes to put all the piece together. I love doing a lets play and going in more detail with this visual novel something about it just ticks all the right boxes with me anyway try it for yourself.
Good plot with various different endings. The art is cool as well :)
I LOVE THIS GAME, OH MEH GERHEARRRRRRED!!!!
too much
Awesome game! Totally love Sam! Great story plot!

Cute, I've redone the story several times over. I was happiest with my choices from the 2nd round. I enjoyed the 'skip' function to fast forward to the next set of choices since I had just read/watched the entire book and wanted more!

I think this is one of my favorite otome games. Definitely more routes in this otome game than most which is a really nice feature. The story plot is really good anfd the art design is really pleasant for the eyes. There are a few grammer errors, but other than that this game is worth playing. Looking forward to the sequel to the game!
This game became my new obsesion in an instant, 10/10 would recomnd. the voice acting is amazing and the art is good, keep up the amazing work! Cant wait for the sequal!! <3 #Dianaissuccubae
10/10 need more fat trolls and demons pls ♥♥♥♥ing kill me

For a free game this game is pretty damn legit! I had a tonne of fun playing it and trying to get into everyones pants. James is my favorite hubbu though, absolutely no doubt about it. He is the Hentai King to my Hentai Queen. So of the drawings in this game are really lacking, but that's alright cos all the ones of James are still amazing ♥  I am currently playing the second game which does cost money, but it totally worth it. The second game is a real step up from the first one, but they are both just as amazing as each other. This game was definitely worth my time! :D  10/10 flamboyant walruses!!
I skipped all the boy routes and read only yuri stories. 10/10

A visual novel about a female protagonist, who's grandfather's death gives her his mansion in the will. After she moves in, she encounters 5 brothers with mysterious origins.  This is a romance RPG with many, many different endings. I woud nitpick about the lack of action, but in the end, this game boils down to the story. It is strange, but in a charming way. I just love that the entire backstory of the brothers is not known to you unless you do multiple endings, and that this game embraces lesbian enteractions. A minor villain that I felt was going to be there for a long time, was sadly only in the game in 2, very short scenes, though they had a lot of tension. The main villian in the story, however, gave me an uneasy vibe the entire time, to the point where you can't tell if they have good intentions or not. I have done everything the game has to offer(got all the achievements and looked at both bloopers :P), and I can safely say I will be purchasing the sequel to this decent FREE game, somewhere down the line.  7.5/10

I have NEVER played a daying simulator/Visual novel - but this one really got me sucked in.   I LOVED the story, personally. Love, lust, desire, and lots of laughs (especially in the blooper section).  YES - the other reviews you read are correct - there are writing errors... but you know what? The game may have a LOT of errors in grammar, repeated words, and typos -- but the story, characters, re-play value, and funny moments will have you wanting more. Seriously. Forget the small 'imperfections' and enjoy the reality that 'K' has cast before you.   If you are a romantic at heart, love cute boys, magic, demons, choices, acheivements, and the idea of dating royalty - this is a game for you.  It's awesome. Seriously. You will become obsessed.   ...Also... I LOVE JAMES and I need him in my life.
A fantastic romance sim, and extremely worth the zero dollars you have to pay for it.

for having only two hours of gameplay and being free to play its story seems decent the only thing holding it down is how quickly it goes by so unless your brain can take alot thrown at it in a short period of time i don't recommend it however if this is a negative revew then why is it positive well thats because of its replayability it has a dozen or so endings giving it a massive amount of replayability with multiple endings you will find your self playing this game for more then just two hours the only down side is that your character can't speak but ehh thats one of the few problems i'v noticed and it isn't really gamebreaking ether so... but yea free to download and multiple endings so yea enjoy

I really enjoyed the story line and how the choices affect the storyline in different ways. In my opinion, I think this is a game definitely worth the time and effort to find all the endings.  Everything about the characters and story was appealing, it was almost impossible for me to stop playing this. I had already gotten two endings in the past few hours I've been playing this. I really hope this good work keeps up.

Sick of Otome games where you're the hapless victim?   Where your blushing could fry an egg, and you're too busy trying to string two coherent sentences together to even  try  to save yourself? Well,  Seduce Me  has that, too, but-!   You can beat the everloving ♥♥♥♥ out of a bully   Take out a devil with your Taekwondo moves   Or become a Demon Queen!  For a game that's free, this has so many ridiculous options that you would be an air-headed Otome ninny  not  to give it a try!

7/8/16 I just started the game. I am enjoying the story so far. I have not completed a path yet, but all the boys are likeable. I look forward to it!  I will update this as necessary  I think the only thing I am really dissapointed with is how quickly everything happens. It feels like everything way too quickly. There is no down time, and definitly not enough to to build up to being hopelessly in love with anyone.   Over all though, it is not bad for free. I would have been dissapointed if I had paid for this. I did however buy the sequal. I hope that will be better.

This game... It's amazing! I absolutely love every second of it! All the boys are amazing and I love going through each route! (But Sam is bae)  I highly recommend getting this game, I mean its free, right?!

For those that enjoy visual novels this is for you. A well written story with mutiple ending and plenty of trophy to obtain. Action, romance, drama, oh my!  I'll leave the rest for you to discover. ^.^
Let me just say, I PLAYED THE ABSOLUTE CRAP OUT OF THIS GAME. While it can be repetitive, overall, I enjoyed it thoroughly. The multiple non-romantic endings were a nice bonus too~
It's engaging, suprising and addictive!
Naomi is a pure girl and suzu a dirty ♥♥♥♥. Everybody who thinks differently is a ♥♥♥♥ing degenerate and should suck ♥♥♥♥ and choke to death on it.
I want next episode already...... <3

A great storyline with lots of intricate endings depending on who you chose. All the endings are equally rich with complex characters and fun dialogue. Can't wait to see what the second one brings as part 2 to the story. Love this!

Despite the couple flaws, the voice acting, art, and music was decent enough, but the story and character development was severely lacking.   I didn't feel a connection between the main protagonist and her love interest other than kissing them, then falling in love immediately afterwards. And keep in mind this game takes place over the course of only a few days. Some of the romantic scenes ended up being a cut-and-paste of another character's which was lazy and made the characters even less individualistic.  Overall I'd give this game a 5/10.  Pros: -Voice Acting is decent.  -Steam Achievements -Free  Cons:  -Too short  -Cut and Paste Romance scenes -No Character Development  If you want to play a simple dating sim game with attractive guys for a short amount of time, then go for it! But don't expect an amazing story out of it.
Not the best I've played but it's certainly worth a play through. It was so adorable. I chose Damien for my first play through and wasa not disappointed! I can't wait to start the sequel!

This game may be simple but it is worthwhile to play, I recommend it if you like romance and fantasy visual novels. Its definitely full of romance ^^ Besides, it FREE!!! with many routes, totally worth it
It was an ok game with some good and some boring stories.  I liked collecting the achievements and kicking Malix's butt every chance I got.  The voice acting made me cringe a lot though.
